item.title: Doing the groceries in parallel
item.description: I’ve started reading the excellent paper “Patterns for Parallel Programming: Understanding and Applying Parallel Patterns with the .NET Framework 4". There is a section in this whitepaper which explains perfectly why parallel programming was and still is such an interesting problem. Consider an analogy: shopping with some friends at a grocery store. You come into the store with a grocery list, and you rip the list into one piece per friend, such that every friend is responsible for retrieving the elements on his or her list.
